subject: Mock and collections.
msgSnippet: I have two questions: JUnit have support to mock classes like JMock? I have a problem with collections; every time that I need make a unit test for a
messageBody:
I have two questions:

JUnit have support to mock classes like JMock?
I have a problem with collections; every time that I need make a unit
test for a collection, I make a sampled test (inference test), but
make this is very painful.
Let me show what I mean:

Suppose that I have a collections of SimpleProduct class; that class
have 3 attributes: name, type, assembleTime. - I know that it is a
terrible class.
Than for test the collection methods like: add, remove, update, etc...
I use 4 mockSimpleProduct objects populated with some data; - I do
this in all almost all methods of the collection class. The tasks of
create, populate, add, testAllAttributes of all items is very
tediously.
I looking for a way for do this with less effort. In the Internet I
can't find patterns examples for this kind of problem, honestly I
found no one example code of test patterns.

(Sorry about the bad English and thanks about some help)
